description: Add Only flag determines whether the service will allow updates.  Set the flag to 1 for Add Only.  Set the flag to 0 or simply do not include the flag to allow Updates.

Interest_and_Late_Fee_Calculation_RuleOb.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule Reference

Interest_and_Late_Fee_Calculation_Rule_f.description: Contains a unique identifier for the Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule.
When Use On-Account Amount is set to true, any on-account amount a customer may have will be applied to their delinquent invoices before calculating any interest or late fees.
Set the Include Partial Month flag to yes to calculate a finance charge for the entire month even if the month has already started.

Enter the minimum number of days for a past due invoice to generate a finance charge. As an example, the minimum days is defined as 15, an invoice eligible for finance charges is eligible for 1 full month of interest, however, an invoice generated on the 20th is not eligible.
The number of days in a year to be used in finance charge calculations.

Interest_and_Late_Fee_Calculation_Option.description: Element Containing Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule Data.

validation.validation: To configure Minimum Days, set the Include Partial Month to Yes.
validation.description: To configure Minimum Days, set the Include Partial Month to Yes.

validation.validation: This is an Add only web service. To update an existing rule, set the Add Only flag to zero or remove it.
The Reference ID you've submitted for this update doesn't match the Reference ID of the default Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule. Submit the correct Reference ID.
Submit a value that's greater than zero for the required # of Days in a Year field.
validation.description: Submit a value that's greater than zero for the required # of Days in a Year field.

Interest_and_Late_Fee_Calculation_Rule_f.description: Contains a unique identifier for the Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule.
The order in which this rule will be applied.  Rules take precedence in ascending order.

When Use On-Account Amount is set to true, any on-account amount a customer may have will be applied to their delinquent invoices before calculating any interest or late fees.

validation.validation: Enter an Order that is not already in use by another Interest and Late Fee Calculation Rule.
